intro: Alaticaulia virgo-cuencae, commonly known as the Cuenca velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its velvety foliage and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
